#Text=Lanzarote
#Text=Lanzarote is in the Canary Islands , part of Spain .
#Text=Regions and cities
#Text=The resorts of Lanzarote are in the south and southeast of the island , most of them are only a few decades old .
#Text=The traditional municipalities are in the middle of the island , and agriculture is still present .
#Text=The north-west of the island is sparsely populated and is characterized by bizarre volcanic structures .
#Text=To the north is the Chinijo Archipelago .
#Text=It includes the smaller island of La Graciosa and four other islands , including Alegranza and Montana Clare , both uninhabited .
#Text=The island is divided into several regions around the biggest cities :
#Text=Arrecife .
#Text=Greatest area , the island 's capital .
#Text=It 's the nerve center of the island and almost obligatory entrance point of Lanzarote ( unless you come via Playa Blanca ) .

#Text=The city has no great attraction except for its coastal area : Playa del Reducto , a pretty calm beach , Fort San Gabriel on an islet accessible by La puente de los Bolas , and the Charco of San Gines , lagoon of sea water surrounded by a beautiful walk .
#Text=The other center of interest of the city hides towards the merchandise port .
#Text=It is the International Museum of Contemporary Art which took its quarters in the fort San José .
#Text=Designed by Cesar Manrique , the museum also houses a gourmet restaurant at reasonable prices .
#Text=Haria .
#Text=In the north , with famous volcanic caves and the most green area .
#Text=After crossing a pass from Teguise , Haria appears like an oasis at the bottom of a valley .
#Text=With a nickname " Ten thousand palm trees valley " , Haria contains palms than a classic city .
#Text=The major attraction of Haria is the house of César Manrique .
#Text=Excentric , the artist 's last home is an unfinished work .
#Text=The center is quite small but nice .
#Text=At the Leon y Castilla square , it is possible to take a break on the terrace of a café , in the shade of eucalyptus .
#Text=On the same square , a craft market happens every Saturday morning , selling local products .
#Text=San Bartolomé .
#Text=Central city of the island .
#Text=San Bartolomé is above all a large crossroads between the North ( Tinajo ) , South ( Arrecife , East ( Geria Valley ) and west ( Teguise ) .
#Text=A gigantic sculpture by Cesar Manrique The monument to the peasant is visible at the intersection of these roads .
#Text=Beyond this symbolic work , Casa Museu , in the same place , allows to appreciate the local culture and its ( peasant ) history .
#Text=Half way between a museum and a the craft shop , the creation " manriquienne " also houses a restaurant .
#Text=Teguise .
#Text=Former capital , with the holiday resort Costa Teguise .
#Text=It naturally presents the most representative face of the traditional aristocratic architecture .
#Text=Walking through ancient cobbled streets or around the church square , the visitor can admire numbers of facades , massive doors or other wooden balconies .

#Text=The Spinola Palace , home to the Timple Museum ( local musical instrument ) and the piracy museum hosted at Santa Barbara Fort ( outside the city , placed on a volcano ) are the two unavoidable attractions of the city .
#Text=Also here , a large weekly market occurs on Sunday , attracting crowds of tourists - though it 's rather uninteresting , since mostly overpriced rubbish is sold here .
#Text=Tías .
#Text=The city is not very interesting , the municipality is primarily known for Puerto del Carmen seaside resort - which is even bigger than the city .
#Text=The vineyards of the Garia valley are also here .
#Text=Tinajo .
#Text=At the north of the island and the edge of the Parque Natural de Los Volcanes , it 's the most authentic and secluded .
#Text=The flow of tourists from the south and east of the island stops mostly in the Geria Valley or Timanfaya National Park .
#Text=Two points are worth a visit : Mancha Blanca on one side ( hermitage of Los Dolores and Sunday morning market ) and the agricultural museum El Patio on the other .
#Text=The Lanzaroteño identity is undoubtedly most present here .
#Text=Yazia .
#Text=A tourist center and ferry port Playa Blanca .
#Text=The most spectacular scenery on the island .
#Text=If the north of the island has been valued by the artistic work of Cesar Manrique , the landscapes of the south ( and thus the municipality of Yaiza ) are sufficient for themselves .
#Text=Yaiza resides between Timanfaya , Papayago and el Golfo - a charming little sleepy village .
#Text=There is little to see except maybe in the neighboring village of Uga , a smoked salmon smokehouse ( you can buy one , too ) and a dromedary ( camel ) breeding center .
#Text=The latter organizes daily round trips to Timanfaya , performing a promenade for the coming tourists .
#Text=Lanzarote is in the same time zone as rest of the Canary Islands - Western European Time ( WET ) .
#Text=This means the time is synchronized e.g. with Portugal and United Kingdom .
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=Costa Teguise
#Text=Puerto del Carmen
#Text=Playa Blanca
#Text=Montaña Clara - The smallest island of the Canary Islands .
#Text=Alegranza -
#Text=In the most northern part of the Canary Islands , Alegranza is another one of the smaller scaled islands .
#Text=Its name comes from the Spanish word for ' Joy ' .
#Text=The terrain is mostly flat , home to only one small volcano .
#Text=The island is part of a conservation act with ( Chinijo Archipelago ) Natural Park , so it has no active or documented inhabitants .
#Text=The historic lighthouse of ( Punta Delgada ) can be found on the eastern part of the island .
#Text=Built in 1865 , it was declared a historical monument in December 2002 .
#Text=La Graciosa - Derived from the Spanish word for ' graceful ' , this volcanic island was formed by the Canary hot spot .
#Text=The entire island is composed of volcanic rock and sand .
#Text=It is also apart of the Islands conservation groups Parque Natural del Archipiélago Chinijo , Reserve of the Biosphere , and " Marine Reserve of La Graciosa " .
#Text=Having only a population of approximately 700 , there are only two inhabited areas on the Island . those areas are Caleta del Sebo and summer-friendly Casas de Pedro Barba .
#Text=The island has a school , lyceum , post office , supermarkets , a bank , port , beaches , and — except bar-restaurants — a square where bicycles can be hired ( plaza ) .
#Text=The main industry of the island is tourism and fishing .
#Text=The climate of the island is one of the most commonly reported pull factors for travelers .
#Text=Streets and roads on La Graciosa are unpaved sand .
#Text=The Gracioseras can often be seen early each morning sweeping the streets smooth of the previous night 's footprints .
#Text=Motor vehicles are strictly prohibited and limited to a handful of licensed vehicles for special purposes .

#Text=Since the roads are bad , and cars have to be shipped to Lanzarote for repair , about 70 % of the motor vehicles on the island are old Land Rovers which often can be repaired by a local serviceman .
#Text=There are no natural water sources on the island .
#Text=Desalinated water has to be piped directly from Lanzarote since 2001 .
#Text=The North - The North of Lanzarote is rural , and unusually green when compared to the rest of the island .
#Text=The main town is Haria , and there are three fishing villages , Punta Mujeres , Arrieta and Orzola .
#Text=The area is also home to two attraction Jameos del Agua , and Cueva de los Verdes
